CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 27, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "Making Final Report - One of the best jobs of tracking down bandits here came to light in Criminal Court last week when Judge William McNaugher commended Detectives Fred Smith, Voyle Parker, John Thompson and Lieut. James Robinson for the work they did in bringing about the arrest of five men who participated in a holdup in Sewickley last November. Detective Thompson is seated at the typewriter making out the final report of the case, while (left to right) Lieut Robertson and Detectives Parker and Smith discuss the details at headquarters. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Police Detective John "Johnny" Thompson at typewriter, with Lieutenant James Robertson, Detective Voyle Parker, and Detective Fred Smith standing behind him in police headquarters
